info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 12 at 11:34AM PST until March 13 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM PDT SUNDAY ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow above 5000 feet elevation expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches. Winds gusting 30 to 40 mph in exposed areas. * WHERE...Above 5000 feet in the Southern and South Central Oregon Cascades for areas north of highway 140. This includes portions of highways 62, 232, 230 and 138 near Crater Lake, Diamond Lake, and Willamette Pass. * WHEN...From 4 PM PST Saturday to 11 AM PDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on snow covered roads. Visibility will be reduced at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy snowfall with rates of 1 inch per hour are possible, mainly late this evening into early Sunday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
